question: Under which of the following acts, a Special Court was established to try in England any offences committed in India?
explanation: Under Pitt's India Act, 1784, a special court consisting of three judges, four peers and six members of the House of Commons was constituted to try in England any offence committed in India. This, act continued to be in force upto 1858 but in 1786 some of its provisions were amended.
